731065f-a.text:
(1)
Washington Bridge, at Manhattan end, as viewed northward from High Bridge. The land shown is the Highbridge Park with the Harlem Speedway skirting the river. This photo is from a reversed negative.
October 1, 1897.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The opposite side of the Washington Bridge, Manhattan end, as viewed
southward from above High Bridge.
October 1, 1897.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(Not dry mount items).
731065f-a.title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - [High Bridge - Harlem Speedway.]

731065f-b.text:
(1)
Washington Bridge, at Manhattan end, as viewed northward from High Bridge. The land shown is the Highbridge Park with the Harlem Speedway skirting the river. This photo is from a reversed negative.
October 1, 1897.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The opposite side of the Washington Bridge, Manhattan end, as viewed
southward from above High Bridge.
October 1, 1897.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(Not dry mount items).
731065f-b.title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - [High Bridge - Harlem Speedway.]

731069f-a.text:
(1)
View of Washington Bridge, Manhattan end; looking north from High Bridge; from 181st Street, across Harlem Riyer, to Washington Heights.
Was completed in 1889, at a cost of nearly 42.700.000.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Cellection.
(2)
View of Washington Bridge, looking northwest.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
731069f-a.title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - [High Bridge.]

731069f-b.text:
(1)
View of Washington Bridge, Manhattan end; looking north from High Bridge; from 181st Street, across Harlem Riyer, to Washington Heights.
Was completed in 1889, at a cost of nearly 42.700.000.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Cellection.
(2)
View of Washington Bridge, looking northwest.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
731069f-b.title: Bridges - Washington Bridge - [High Bridge.]

731073f-a.text:
Washington Bridge spans the Harlem River from Manhattan to the Bronx. This view is looking North from the Eastern end of High Bridge in the Bronx.
About 1920.
Rotogrrph Co.
No Reppoductions.
731073f-a.title: Bridges - Washington Bridge [spans the Harlem River from Manhattan to the Bronx - High Bridge (North).]

731074f-a.text:
Washington Bridge, spans the Harlem River, from Manhattan to the Bronx. View looking north, from eastern end of High Bridge.in the Bronz.
February 29, 1928.
New York Edison Co.

731076f.text:
Washington Bridge, spanning the Harlem River, from upper Manhattan; at West 181st Street and Amsterdam Ave., to the Bronx. The photographer's vantage point is in the latter and he is viewing towards the former.
About 1932.
Ewing Galloway.
731076f.title: Bridges - Washington Bridge [spanning the Harlem River from upper Manhattan at West 181st Street and Amsterdam Avenue to the Bronx.]

731077f-a.text:
(1)
Overlooking High Bridge Park, north east, to the Washington Bridge;
from roof-top at 175th Street and Amsterdam Ave.
October 30, 1934.

(2)
Washington Bridge, north from, above High Bridge.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
